title: J0M
author: J0M
content: 1) Go to https://hodlbitcoin.vercel.app2) Insert your current Bitcoin holdings3) Click "generate chart" buttonThanks to this tool I can see that my holdings for which I have paid thousands of $$$ were worth only a few hundred a few years before lol

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: A small bug I found: 1 BTC is not considered a valid amount for some reason. I can type 2, 3, etc. but typing 1 without the decimal will keep the button disabled.

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on May 21, 2022, 09:11:52 AMA small bug I found: 1 BTC is not considered a valid amount for some reason. I can type 2, 3, etc. but typing 1 without the decimal will keep the button disabled.That is because the default chart is calculating for 1BTC already. Generating a chart at that point would be redundant as you can just work with the landing page, which already has '1' filled in.This tool is cool and can be useful to show you different valuations of your holdings overtime and make reasonable estimations for the future.Could there be way to calculate for before 2015?

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: The idea is simple, but I like the design. Perhaps it would be more fun if a person could insert multiple entries (for example, holding a certain amount of BTC in a certain period, and then another amount in another period), that would be more valuable to see, IMO, as here the chart is essentially the same, and only the numbers in USD change based on how much a person is holding.Quote from: J0M on May 21, 2022, 09:40:54 AMThe first data point at this moment is from 23 February 2014 but I'll try to obtain more old data somehow. Cheers, mate.There's data since the end of April 2013 on Coingecko: https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/bitcoin. Perhaps, you could use this to make the chart bigger.
